help.title: How turn order methods work
help.description: Learn how each method determines who picks first

manual.howItWorks: The administrator decides the turn order manually by dragging and dropping members into the desired order. No automatic calculation is performed.
manual.whenToUse: When the administrator wants full control over the order, or for special occasions where automation isn't appropriate.
manual.whatMembersSee: Members see their position in the queue and can follow who picks next.

quotaBased.howItWorks: The system sums all available points and divides equally. You pick shifts until your quota is met. The order is reversed between each occasion — the last picker from last time picks first next time.
quotaBased.howItWorksSteps:
1. The system counts all available points for the period
2. Points are divided equally — each member gets a quota
3. Members pick shifts in turn order until their quota is met
4. The order is reversed each time: whoever picked last previously picks first next time
5. First time: alphabetical order by name
quotaBased.whenToUse: Best when the stable wants everyone to do roughly equal work. Ideal for regular monthly or quarterly occasions where fairness in both workload and pick order matters.
quotaBased.whatMembersSee: Members see their position in the queue, their point quota, and who has picked before them.
quotaBased.memberPosition: You are in position {{position}} of {{total}}. Your quota is {{quota}} points.

pointsBalance.howItWorks: Turn order is determined by how many points you've earned in the last {{days}} days. The member with the lowest points picks first. The system self-balances over time.
pointsBalance.howItWorksSteps:
1. The system checks how many points each member has earned in the last 90 days
2. Members are sorted by points — lowest first
3. Whoever has done the least gets to pick first and gets the best choice of dates
4. New members with zero history always pick first
5. Self-balancing: whoever picks first accumulates more points and moves down next time
pointsBalance.whenToUse: Best when the stable wants to compensate members who've been doing more than their share, or when participation has varied. The system self-balances over time.
pointsBalance.whatMembersSee: Members see their total points, how they compare to others, and their position in the queue.

fairRotation.howItWorks: The starting position rotates by one step each time. Everyone gets to be first exactly once every {{total}} occasions.
fairRotation.howItWorksSteps:
1. The system checks the turn order from the last occasion
2. The starting position shifts by one: if Anna was first last time, Bengt goes first this time
3. Everyone gets to be first exactly once every N occasions (N = number of members)
4. First time (no history): alphabetical order
fairRotation.whenToUse: Best when the stable wants maximum transparency and predictability. Simplest to understand — no calculations or point tracking needed.
fairRotation.whatMembersSee: Members see their position and exactly when they'll be first next.
fairRotation.memberPosition: Position {{position}} of {{total}}. You will be first in {{turnsUntilFirst}} occasions.

quotaBased.workload: Best — everyone gets equal point quota
quotaBased.pickFairness: Best — order is reversed each time
